Description: An underdeveloped voidsent balloon thrashes about inside the globe, ready to self-destruct at any moment.
Used for reaching those out-of-reach places.
A lily sigil is carved into this tiny ivory button.
The underside of this colorful funguar cap is packed with scores of gills, each containing innumerable spores.
The glass used to create this receptacle is over a half an ilm thick. Needless to say, whatever it is that goes inside will be well protected.
If one can consider a drifting semi-sentient mass of elementally charged aetherial matter 'alive.'
Cloudy water gathered from Hopeseed Pond.
When used as bait, a fish this size is sure to attract even the largest of beasts.
Almost as large as an aldgoat leg, but several times leaner.
Legend says that Eorzea was once inhabited by a race of tiny creatures called brownies, and they would use the spores of this particular mushroom to paint their faces for battle.
From myrrh to sandalwood, the soothing aromas emitted by these alchemically crafted incense cones will instantly take one back to the Jewel of the Desert.
A long piece of planed wood dropped by the ever-graceless Florent.
An exceptionally large egg with a seemingly unbreakable shell. When it hatches, the baby adamantoise that emerges will likely be as large as a hound.
The bright frothy blood of a drachen scalekin. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
A trophy claimed by U'odh Nunh from the dying hands of an Amalj'aa warrior.
A confusion of teeth, bones, and claws strung onto a piece of leather. Supposedly from the pattern in which items are ordered, other Amalj'aa can glean the name and rank of the necklace's wearer.
A few more bells under the sun and this fish will turn ripe as a faerie apple.
A sharp claw-like protrusion taken from the leg of a russet yarzon.
What ever would you put in an empty angler-sized sack?
What ever could be floundering about in this angler-sized sack?
A deep caramel-colored spirit made from twice distilling fine red wine and then aging it in rosewood barrels for at least thirty summers.
A simple burlap sack filled by Kuzai Tazai with several freshly cut slabs of dodo meat.
Several onzes of blasting powder packed into a hollowed-out gourd and affixed with a simple fuse long enough to give the lighter time to toss the makeshift device away without losing his hand.
A bronze medal engraved with the head of a mythical beast that somewhat resembles a Miqo'te.
An order made out to Wineport vintner Shamani Lohmani.
A light, porous wood used in sealing wine bottles.
Shamani Lohmani's first attempt at winemaking. At least the name sounds legitimate.
The beautifully patterned hide of a coeurl native to Raincatcher Gully.
Sap of a palm tree fermented inside an island coconut shell. Far more potent than wine made from grapes, palm wine, if brewed for too long, can cause loss of eyesight or even death.
A cutting from a Bacchus grape vine─a variety of sweet wine grape thought to be long extinct.
A vintage wine from the year 1547 of the Sixth Astral Era.
The wind generated by these lighter-than-air cores is the bane of beskirted women (and bekilted men) across the realm.
Due to the tendency of the flowers to grow randomly from its long hard stalks, the roselle makes a terrible bouquet.
Sautéed Wellwick worm, a soft-boiled adamantoise egg, and a goblin cheese soufflé.
A colorful selection of fragrant wildflowers. The perfect accent to any meal.
A vintage wine from the year 1547 of the Sixth Astral Era.
A formal request by one Blaugybal to be reinstated into his former Maelstrom unit.
This could be the largest warmwater trout ever to have lived. Past tense.
Superstitious smallfolk believe one gains the memories of any being he eats. Ask yourself this─do you truly wish to know how this warmwater trout lived?
The magick-imbued heart of a golem.
A six-ilm retractable claw found on the velociraptor's middle toe, used to slice the bellies of its prey. This handicaps the victims, ensuring they are still alive when the raptor begins to feed.
While certainly large enough to fit a coeurl, you worry how the bag will fare against a score of razor-sharp claws.
You shudder to think a thin layer of burlap is all that separates you from a flurry of fangs and claws.
A red-hot piece of carbonized wood that can be used to light fuses much like the ones found on kobold-built explosives.
A thick, sticky oil collected from the underbelly of a river-dwelling salamander.
Sour red cooked with various spices and citrus rinds over a low flame so as to preserve the alcoholic content.
Heated in the warm springs beneath O'Ghomoro, this mulled wine is said to cure countless ailments. And those ailments it cannot cure, it will help one forget.
Ice-cold water gathered from Bronze Lake.
What appears to be the pitiful remains of distilling equipment used by alchemists to work their magic.
Unlike carpenter's chisels which have flat heads, the bull-point chisel has a pointed one and is used by expert goldsmiths to perforate soft metals.
This tool is oft employed by goldsmiths or clockwork engineers to seize and manipulate minuscule pieces of wire.
By some manner of clockwork wizardry, this strange contraption can precisely measure and follow the twenty-four bells in a single turn of the sun.
When lit, this incense releases a citrus-like aroma that most vilekin abhor.
A heavy leather pouch entrusted to you by Brother Esmour. It must contain hundreds of coins.
A heavy leather pouch entrusted to you by Sister Zozoru. You cannot begin to guess how much coin it might contain.
Crisp, buttery cookies dusted with a hint of fragrant cinnamon.
How you are able to fit this stiff Scion of the Seventh Dawn corpse into your bag is a mystery best left unsolved.
The sylph's peaceful expression belies the fact she no longer lives.
In addition to being tattered, it is also frayed, torn, moth-eaten, lice-ridden, and stained with what appears to be blood. You get what you pay for.
The arm of a sabotender del sol. The fleshy interior holds a surprising amount of fresh, drinkable water.

Literally meaning “water of the sun,” Aqua del Sol was originally brought back by expeditions to the New World far across the Indigo Deep. Not long after, Eorzeans began making their own variation of the drink from the sabotenders and cactuars of Thanalan.
With a decent wind, the stench of rotting dodo meat can carry for malms, attracting all manner of creatures.
Goods bound for market and stolen by a band of heretics.
Goods bound for market and stolen by a band of heretics.
Goods bound for market and stolen by a band of heretics.
Goods bound for market and stolen by a band of heretics.
This letter of introduction was penned by Francel.
This wood has been dried and chopped, and is ready to toss on a fire.
Mutton any fresher would still be attached to the karakul's back.
Soft and fluffy, this skin would go perfect in front of a fireplace.
What looks silver is not always silver (but most of the time it's silver).
The only thing dull about this knife is its luster. The blade, on the other hand, appears sharp enough to cut through bone.
The rough white hide of a mountain-dwelling snow wolf.
A thick, sturdy rope twisted from common brambleweed. Sheepherders oft employ the rope in tying up the legs of their stock before sending them to market.
A young male karakul named Sebastian bound with brambleweed rope.
A red-hot piece of carbonized wood that can be used to light bonfires.
When boiled in water, the bark of this rare yew found growing only in the Twelveswood turns black as pitch.
A neatly drafted report of Ixali activity in Coerthas.
The disembodied middle finger of a voidsent bomb.
A hastily drafted report of Ixali activity in the Black Shroud.
The brand of an unbeliever and enemy of the Holy See.
A thesis written by Alka Zolka on the proper habiliments of a scholar.
The deep blue-green sap extracted from the tiny leaves of this fleshy plant was once used across Vylbrand to dye cloth.
A long, complex refining process has removed almost 99% of all impurities from this ceruleum, making it suitable for fuel.
Bouquets such as these are oft used as offerings to the dead.
A rare, expensive intoxicant made with the water from the Weeping Saint.
Carved from elementally aspected crystals by noble-born Juline of Ishgard.
A standard rosary carried by followers of the Ishgardian Orthodox Church and the Holy See.
Countless readings over countless generations have left this old tome faded and worn.
Volume six of astroscope readings taken at the First Dicasterial Observatorium of Aetherial and Astrological Phenomena in the year 1572 of the Sixth Astral Era.
A glowing letter of introduction addressed to House Durendaire.
A glowing letter of introduction addressed to House Durendaire.
A sealed scroll addressed to Lord Drillemont of House Durendaire and carelessly dropped by Nivie.
A cross section of meat sliced from the tail of a spotted mudpuppy. The bone has not been removed.
The rubbery texture of mudpuppy meat will ensure your jaws grow exhausted before your belly grows full.
The worldly possessions of a heretic delivered from his sins.
Chinchilla fat is oft used by Ishgardian monks to create the tallow they use for their candles.
The diamond-hard, fire-resistant scale of a mighty Dravanian.
Even after death, its beady eyes glare at you with what can only be described as a deep-seated hate.
A lavish blend of unnecessarily expensive ingredients based on a recipe conceived at the Alchemists' Guild in Ul'dah.
So cold, these cores are said to freeze the very air around them, making them perfect for cooling drinks on an especially hot day.
The scroll contains what appears to be an official papal appointment to the position of inquisitor.
The bloody remnants of a broken weapon left on the field of battle.
A powerful concoction which induces severe anger and acute madness.
A rusted iron key used to unlock the dungeons at Whitebrim Front.
A heavy tool used to chip away at rock-hard sheets of ice.
This sweet distilled spirit warms from the inside.
This brambleweed rope twisted from several thinner ropes appears strong enough to support the weight of a grown Roegadyn.
A simple vessel that will most likely last longer than its maker.
A simple clay pot that has been treated on the inside with a special alchemical sealant.
It would not be a lie to say that this sledgehammer was made for harvesting corrupted crystals.
The deep-crimson lifeblood of a voidsent snurble. Remarkably, one of the hirsute creatures contains less than a half-score of drops.
This variety of colorless quartz can often be found mixed in with the other precious stones growing on a doblyn's back.
This brilliant feather reflects light as if it were actually made of gold.
Nary a drop of sweet ambrosia remains within.
The bottle contains a briny vintage found in tuns recovered from the sea.
A blend of exotic spices imported from well beyond the Sea of Jade.
A fragrant mist created by collecting the essential oil of Azeyma roses via an arduous distillation process.
A tiny black seed gathered from a sylvan lily found growing in the Black Shroud.
The wind generated by these lighter-than-air cores has the force to send a man's hat sailing over five score yalms.
This bright blood-colored ore is thought to be a symbol of loyalty and honesty.
This particular sample happens to be covered in spriggan offal...
An aetherially charged mass of energy taken from an ectoplasmic entity.
An aetherially charged mass of energy taken from a plasmoid.
Various items gathered from a razed campsite.
A sealed communication decorated with gold leaf and raised lettering.
A sealed communication decorated with a pressed dry flower.
A sealed communication contained in an ordinary, yellowing envelope.
The prized possession of a gigas who no longer possesses the capacity to possess it.
Prized by beastman witch doctors for its supposed ability to increase virility.
The spindly white roots of a mare's tail─an aquatic plant that earns its name from its uncanny resemblance to a chocobo tail.
A charred sheet of metal torn from the rusting carcass of a fallen imperial dreadnaught-class airship.
A complex-looking device that can detect the strength of electromagnetic waves.

Standard-issue light infantry battle gear reinforced with carbon and cermet fibers to provide maximum protection with minimum loss of mobility. The scars of war cover both back and front of this piece.
Standard-issue light infantry battle helm reinforced with an aluminum alloy to provide maximum protection against severe head trauma. The scars of war cover all sides of this piece.

Standard-issue light infantry battle gear reinforced with carbon and cermet fibers to provide maximum protection with minimum loss of mobility. The outer layer has been repaired to appear good as new.
Standard-issue light infantry battle helm reinforced with an aluminum alloy to provide maximum protection against severe head trauma. The outer shell has been repaired to appear good as new.
When lit, this tube emits a continuous plume of white smoke. Used to inform others of one's current position.
The clockwork soul of a mammet.
A thin, rectangular piece of what appears to be cermet. Used to deactivate certain magitek security terminals.
The thin transparent wing of a ked.
Members of the Maelstrom ground levy known as the Red Swallows use these bronze tags to identify the bodies of their fallen brothers.
This type of hastily thrown together explosive is used by the Red Swallows as a part of their fight-and-flight battle tactics.
A colorful account of the Red Swallows' heroic contributions during an operation to demolish a recently constructed kobold furnace.
Blasting powder used to clear tunnels in mines, though twenty-four onzes is a tad overkill.
A traditional blend of herbs and sandworm blubber used by warriors of the U tribe to soothe battle-weary joints and muscles.
Intended for delivery to the Maelstrom transportation unit.
A simple explosive device employed by the Maelstrom levies in battle.
Each serving contains two pieces of fishtack, a dried herring, and a ginger cookie.
Forget that you are eating the raw gelatinous umbrella of a flying jellyfish and you might just enjoy it.

Only those who have never eaten basilisk meat claim it has the consistency of chicken. Those who have eaten basilisk meat will tell you the consistency is more akin to boot leather...as is the flavor.
A hodgepodge of basilisk meat, random roots, and whatever other edible flora (and fauna) can be foraged from the desert.
One of these blades is presented to each of the Immortal Flames infantry in a simple wooden box lined with velvet.
Claws are thought to contain the same flammable gases found in the bodies of voidsent grenades, therefore extreme caution is recommended when handling.
What exactly Memezofu was thinking when blending together every potion on his person, we shall never know.
The thin transparent layer of skin which covers the eye of a voidsent ahriman.
A writ of permission granting free passage through the otherwise off-limits White Wolf Gate in New Gridania.
A thesis written by Alka Zolka on the proper habiliments of a scholar.
The deep blue-green sap extracted from the tiny leaves of this fleshy plant was once used across Vylbrand to dye cloth.
The finishing touches are all that await these fine pieces of scholarly raiments.
The final remains of the wandering Padjal, ATowaCant.
A wooden cargo crate used by Mealvaan's Gate to train new assessors.
Both sides are filled with letters and markings unlike any you have seen in Eorzea.
A spell tome entrusted to you by Arcanists' Guild guildmaster K'rhid Tia. The leather binding is uncracked and its pages are still crisp.
A short list of orders drafted by Mealvaan's Gate assessor K'lyhia.
Herring so fresh it still flaps its fins in one final desperate attempt to propel itself from your back, through the air, and back into the sweet saltwater it once called home.
The culinarian Opylona would have you believe her homemade eel pie is far more delicious than Mother Miounne's realm-famous handmade eel pie.
A leather purse filled to bursting with gil.

The veil of mystery surrounding this otherwise ordinary sack is so thick it could suffocate an aurochs. Extended poking and prodding reveals that the contents may include a tunic (or tablecloth), a book (or cutting board), and a pair of glasses (which are now most likely bent beyond repair).
A colorful cotton undergarment worn for countless summers by the dancer Ealdgyth.
Wine so old, no one alive can remember when it was bottled. The cork appears to still be intact.
Just like Fufucha's old ma used to make.
Add a few spikes and a leash, and this would kill at parties.
You can sense great power in this tiny precious stone.
The cold blood of a creature not of this world. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
The cold blood of a creature not of this world. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
The cold blood of a creature not of this world. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
This malodorous lifeblood of the Amalj'aa black mage is so dark a red, it almost appears black.
A quaint keepsake made from a single tiny crystal.
The shrill tone emitted by this bone-carved whistle is believed to summon minions of the Dravanian Horde.
Proof you (or someone else) slew Greywine.
The dull glow of this soul crystal tells a tale of neglect.
An odd contraption used for measuring surrounding aether levels.
An odd contraption used for measuring surrounding aether levels.
An odd contraption borrowed from Widargelt used for measuring surrounding aether levels.
An odd contraption used for measuring surrounding aether levels.
Shriveled hearts removed from the lifeless husks of three forsaken souls who were, until recently, undead.
Strange yet beautiful runes have been carved upon the surface of this otherwise normal-looking crystal.
An ordinary bag containing ordinary beans...or are they!?
The shrill tone emitted by this bone-carved whistle is believed to summon minions of the Dravanian Horde.
Collected directly from the comb. If the bees are hungry, they will simply have to make more.
A simple glance will not reveal what strange ingredients were used to brew this curious concoction.
A spicy dish made from sparhawk eggs and powdered bomb claws.
The pungent and highly corrosive secretion of an antlion.
If the purpose of this unnaturally green potation is to overwhelm unwary passersby with its noisome odor, then the experiment was a success.
The thick white sap extracted from this ochu root has the power to grant its user wondrously terrible visions.
The ossified bone of some long-dead beast...or man!
A large round slice of Wellwick worm white meat.
An aromatic spice native to the Black Shroud used to liven up bland dishes.
One of the secret ingredients used when brewing MunTuy sauce.
A simple clay pot that has been treated on the inside with a special alchemical sealant.
This warded pot contains a corrupted crystal.
A simple clay pot that has been treated on the inside with a special alchemical sealant.
A simple clay pot that has been treated on the inside with a special alchemical sealant.
This warded pot contains a corrupted crystal.
A letter of introduction penned by Portelaine.
A slip of parchment granting you crossing to the Isles of Umbra.
A beautiful antique ring worn by Lancefer's wife.
A single streak of bright-yellow fat runs through this otherwise lean chunk of porcine flesh.
A list documenting all recent sightings of the elder primal Odin.
Forget that you are eating the rancid gelatinous umbrella of a flying jellyfish and you might just enjoy it.
Designed by master smith Mimidoa, these earplugs can block out almost any sound, including the song of the infamous siren.
A standard-issue blade for all Garlean infantry.
The bundle appears to contain food rations and a flask of drinking water.
This particular brandewine has been aged in cherrywood barrels, giving it a sweet aroma and a deep amber hue.
After smoothing out the crumpled piece of parchment, you are able to discern a list of findings scrawled upon it.
This brambleweed rope twisted from several thinner ropes appears strong enough to support the weight of a grown Roegadyn.

To make cactus tea, sabotender fruit is dried, ground into a fine powder, and then left to sit a full night under Menphina's gaze to frighten away the spirit of the sabotender that dwelled inside the seeds. The powder is then added to boiling water and stirred until a foam forms upon the water's surface. The foam is given to break fever, the remaining liquid discarded under a rock found to the north of the patient.
A glowing letter of introduction addressed to House Durendaire.
A sister of the faerie apple developed by the Greatloam Growery to better withstand the elements, while yielding larger harvests.
A glowing letter of introduction addressed to House Durendaire.
A potent potable brewed from sabotender fruit by desert aldgoat herders to help them forget the fact they are aldgoat herders.
The crimson blood of a recently slain karakul. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
The body of this poor soul has been defiled in more ways than one.
The source of a stroper's bad breath can be found within.
The sharp, wide blade is perfect for removing sea life attached to foundation pillars.

The pungent odor of this hard yellow cheese veined with blue-green mold is most comparable to the warm, damp boot of a zombie after stepping in ripe chocobo dung. Goblins claim it is a delicacy, but then again, they have their masks to filter out the aroma.
A stunning bouquet of roses named after Azeyma, the Warden.
The envelope contains what appears to be an official papal appointment to the position of inquisitor.
What looks silver is not always silver (but most of the time it's silver).
Uses for a simple sledgehammer #172: destroying locks on wooden boxes.
Intended for delivery to the Maelstrom transportation unit.
Intended for delivery to the Maelstrom transportation unit.
A trophy taken from the corpse of a kobold priest of the 129th Order.
Bitter tears shed by balor's bells.
The thumb of a three-fingered voidsent bomb...or is it the index finger...or the ring?
A highly combustible substance found in the furnace-hot bellies of fire sprites.

It is believed that flame drakes breathe fire by gnashing their flint-like teeth together until a spark ignites the oily slaver secreted in their heat-resistant maws, which they then spit out onto their prey.
The pristine hide of a white wolf. The color of each individual strand of fur is not white, but actually clear.
Unbearably hot to the touch, this appendage torn from a voidsent napalm will remain hot for moons after the death of the host.
Mutton so tender and juicy, it will slide right off the bone.
A sample of Coerthan soil taken to test to see if it is suitable for growing crops.
A bloody lump of sinewy hippogryph meat. Several feathers still dangle from the flesh.
The tough yet flexible tendon of a biast.
So cold, these cores are said to freeze the very air around them, making them perfect for choking the truth out of devilish voidsent who seek to torment others with their deceiving glamours.
Both sides are filled with letters and markings unlike any you have seen in Eorzea.
The leather binding of this recently crafted tome is uncracked─its pages still crisp.
A short list of orders drafted by Mealvaan's Gate assessor K'lyhia.
Herring so fresh it still flaps its fins in one final desperate attempt to propel itself from your pack, through the air, and back into the sweet saltwater it once called home.
The culinarian Opylona would have you believe her homemade eel pie is far more delicious than Mother Miounne's realm-famous handmade eel pie.
A leather purse filled to bursting with gil.
The veil of mystery surrounding this otherwise ordinary sack is so thick it could suffocate an aurochs.
A colorful cotton undergarment worn for countless summers by the dancer Ealdgyth.
Wine so old, no one alive can remember when it was bottled. The cork appears to still be intact.
Almost large enough for a Lalafellin child, this cane appears more suited for a sylph than a man.
A solid piece of granite suitable for mending walls.
A solid piece of granite suitable for mending almost anything made of stone.
Several moons of snowfall, compacted and hardened to near rock-like consistency.
A dense chalky substance that, when ground into a powder, can be used to make glass.
A rare variety of mythril which emits a soft blue glow.
A rare variety of mythril which emits a soft blue glow. This particular sample appears to contain very few impurities.
A piece of compacted ice and snow hewn from towering Snowcloak.
A piece of compacted ice and snow hewn from towering Snowcloak. This piece is almost completely transparent.
This light colored mineral is mixed with conventional iron by Ishgardian blacksmiths to create what they call “white steel.”
A solid piece of granite suitable for hurtling at invading dragon hordes, as well as building walls.
A slice of partially frozen soil taken from the area near Whitebrim.
A slice of completely frozen soil taken from the area near Whitebrim.
A charred piece of the Agrius's metal hull.
An intact square of the Agrius's heat-resistant outer shielding.
Unaspected crystals as these are found across Mor Dhona, suffocating all life from the area.
A small, smooth stone featuring in its center a single carved symbol representing...something that cannot quite be made out.
Though it maintains the shape it held before its transformation, there is no living matter remaining whatsoever in this tree root.
Though it maintains the shape it held before its transformation, there is no living matter remaining whatsoever in this tree trunk.
Though regarded throughout the realm as highly toxic, Ishgardian physickers are still known to prescribe the herb as an emmenagogue.
Though regarded throughout the realm as highly toxic, Ishgardian physickers are still known to prescribe the herb as an emmenagogue. The young leaves are especially potent.
Straighter than the road upon which a true Ishgardian knight treads, this log hewn from a mature oak tree will make a fine wall or barricade.
This variety of weed grows flush with the ground, making it difficult to pull.
The broken branch of an unidentifiable tree, smoothed by its journey down the Coerthas River.
The trunk of an unidentifiable tree, torn from the hillside in some terrible storm and carried downstream by the mighty Coerthas River.
The larvae of these colorful beetles bore into firs and pines and drain the trees of their lifeblood.
This thick piece of bark is riddled with holes where spotted longicorn larvae have bored into the wood.
Those not made into arrow shafts will be shipped to the local orphanages, where they will be passed out to crotchety old wardens, who will use them to redden the arses of misbehaving boys and girls.
A rare variety of teak that can withstand the frigid climes of Abalathia's Spine.
The cut on this piece of bark could be an encrypted message left by a heretic...or it could be simply a cut.
The cut on this piece of bark is definitely a message left by a heretic for his unbelieving brethren.
To the untrained eye, these specimens are little more than weathered potsherds. However, to a learned naturalist, they are weathered potsherds.
A small, smooth stone featuring in its center a single carved symbol representing one of the Twelve.
The fact that it is long and sturdy, yet not too thick as to be cumbersome, makes this log perfect for erecting scaffolding.
Grass has never been more beautiful.
The tip of this root remains untouched by the slowly spreading crystals, the unaffected portion somehow still alive.
The roots of this trunk remain untouched by the slowly spreading crystals, the unaffected portion somehow still alive.
The pronged waves on the edge of this deadly head allow for easier entry into a target's flesh, while making it more difficult to remove.
The magick-imbued heart of a chert golem.
A simple clay pot that has been treated on the inside with a special alchemical sealant.
This particular sample happens to be covered in spriggan offal...
The giant bone of a Dravanian.
A small piece of blackened metal that may be from the outer shielding of the now-fallen satellite Dalamud.
A paper ward inscribed with a prayer to the patron deity of Ala Mhigo, Rhalgr.
A transparent gem discovered within ruins of the long-lost Allagan Empire.
You sense great power in this tiny precious stone.
You sense great power in this tiny precious stone.
New handwear for a white mage, or handwear for a new white mage?
New legwear for a white mage, or legwear for a new white mage?
New footwear for a white mage, or footwear for a new white mage?
New headgear for a white mage, or headgear for a new white mage?
A new habit for a white mage, or a habit for a new white mage?
The final remains of the wandering Padjal, ATowaCant.
The brands of unbelievers and enemies of the Holy See.
A broad green leaf from a thought-to-be-extinct Bacchus grape vine.
A box that resembles a piece of Allagan masonry, containing a to-scale replica of the Crystal Tower carved from crystal.
The charred remnants of three ashkin hearts─proof that you have overcome Jenlyns's trial.
This strangely warm crystal was given to you by an equally peculiar knight.
A fragrant mist created by collecting the essential oil of Azeyma roses via an arduous distillation process.
An odd contraption used for measuring surrounding aether levels.
Bouquets such as these are oft used as offerings to the dead.
Bouquets such as these are oft used as offerings to the dead.
The cold blood of a creature not of this world. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
The lifeblood of the Ixali black mage. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
The thin ink-like lifeblood of the kobold black mage. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
The warm blood of an adventurer whose adventuring days are now done. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.
A nauseating blend of seemingly random alchemic ingredients mashed up in a mortar and diluted in a bath of stagnant water.
A potent liquor created through the fermentation of hornet carcasses.
A clear glass bottle filled to the brim with cold water.
An exceptionally pungent vinegar made from the fermenting of Coerthas-grown apples.
A linen pouch stuffed with hot pepper powder which can blind a man for several bells if thrown in his eyes. Always wash hands after handling.
Gridanian spring water blessed and imbued with purifying magicks by Brother OAppPesi.
The finishing touches are all that await these fine pieces of scholarly raiments.
This stone may have been the only thing preventing the elder primal Odin's return to Eorzea, and now the stone is destroyed.
The sylph's peaceful expression belies the fact she no longer lives.
A periodic account of happenings in and around the hamlet of Aleport. After recent events, one might assume that this particular report will read more akin to a letter of apology.
The elastic wing of a dusk bat.
A sealed missive addressed to Maelstrom sergeant, Wiltswys.
Contrary to popular belief, pelicans are highly poisonous creatures that spray their victims with a powerful neurotoxin.
This white wine made from the green lowland grapes of La Noscea is said to have a bold citrus flavor with hints of apple, pear, and cinnamon. But most sailors simply claim it “tastes like wine.”
White, six-petaled flowers with bright orange-yellow centers.
Countless years of use have seen the blade dulled and nicked, and the haft worn smooth.
A detailed map of the Amalj'aa stronghold in southern Thanalan.
A potent potation containing the blood of a freshly slain phurble, ground marimo, and several other grotesque ingredients that are best left unspoken.
A potent potation containing the blood of a freshly slain snurble, fermented sea pickles, and several other grotesque ingredients that are best left unspoken.

An excerpt from the chapter entitled “Cinerary Rite,” the words and symbols written in blood upon these pages are said to bind terrible creatures. If disturbed, the ward will weaken, possibly allowing the creatures to escape.
Some say it tastes like chocobo, but most simply do not eat it.

An excerpt from the chapter entitled “Pale Oblation,” the words and symbols written in blood upon these pages are said to bind terrible creatures. If disturbed, the ward will weaken, possibly allowing the creatures to escape.

An excerpt from the chapter entitled “Whispers of the Gem,” the words and symbols written in blood upon these pages are said to bind terrible creatures. If disturbed, the ward will weaken, possibly allowing the creatures to escape.

The rubbery texture of mudpuppy meat will ensure your jaws grow exhausted before your belly grows full.
A small metal key dropped by an Illuminati goblin.
This heavy slab appears to have been cut to a specific shape, implying that somewhere there may be a hole of the same size.
A slip of parchment signed by the weaponsmith Gerolt, documenting monies borrowed from Rowena.
The relic axe Bravura, in such poor repair as to render it unfit for use.
The relic sword Curtana, in such poor repair as to render it unfit for use.
The relic fists Sphairai, in such poor repair as to render them unfit for use.

The relic Artemis Bow, in such poor repair as to render it unfit for use.
The relic grimoire the Veil of Wiyu, in such poor repair as to render it unfit for use.
The relic grimoire Omnilex, in such poor repair as to render it unfit for use.

A fine-grain form of the mineral alumina found in the stomach of the dhorme chimera. It is believed the creature grinds chunks of alumina ore with its powerful jaws and swallows the resulting powder to use as a catalyst for its fiery breath.

A biography of the renowned warrior and sellsword Iron Eater bearing numerous tales of his feats of derring-do.
A work of literature depicting the valorous deeds of Jhal Tristram the True, one of the three first paladins of the Sultansworn.
A book expressing the martial philosophy of Ivon Coeurlfist, penned by his foremost disciple.
A leather-bound copy of religious Ishgardian text portraying the life and times of Saint Reinette.
An ancient tome dating back to the Fifth Astral Era, found languishing in a cave near Bronze Lake.
A manuscript bearing an account of one Ul'dahn thaumaturge's conversations with a wayfaring Padjal.
A collection of song and verse composed by the legendary bard Gilbert, the first individual to bear the title “Godsbow.”
A transcription of an ancient tome documenting the trials and tribulations of a green-eyed woman, now all but forgotten.
A detailed record of an ancient battle in which powerful magi waged a fierce battle for dominance over the world.
This glowing chunk of the Lord of the Inferno's corporeal flesh burns without being consumed.

Holy water gathered from the basin of the Weeping Saint.
A heavy, complex-looking contraption retrieved from the carcass of an abandoned magitek vanguard.
The best-working antidotes are often those made of poison themselves...just try not to get any on you before the antidote is complete.
A Qiqirn delicacy...when the beastmen can manage to steal one away from the nest without becoming dinner themselves for the mother pelican.
The last effects of a poor sylph slain by one of his brethren.
The magicked heart of a golem.
Birds do it. Bees do it. Drink raincatcher nectar, that is.
A thin, rectangular piece of what appears to be cermet. Used to deactivate certain magitek security terminals.
Developed in the 37th year of the first Garlean emperor's reign, only a few onzes of this highly unstable explosive is enough to tear a hole in steel several ilms thick.
A thin, rectangular piece of what appears to be cermet. Used to deactivate certain magitek security terminals.
An odd contraption used for measuring surrounding aether levels.
An odd contraption used for measuring surrounding aether levels.

Developed in the 37th year of the first Garlean emperor's reign, only a few onzes of this highly unstable explosive is enough to tear a hole in steel several ilms thick.
How you are able to fit this stiff Scion of the Seventh Dawn corpse into your bag is a mystery best left unsolved.
The excessive mold growth on this traditional baked treat suggests that it is a leftover from an All Saints' Wake celebration of many years ago.
The excessive mold growth on this traditional baked treat suggests that it is a leftover from an All Saints' Wake celebration of many years ago.
The excessive mold growth on this traditional baked treat suggests that it is a leftover from an All Saints' Wake celebration of many years ago.
Oil the tonberries use to light their lanterns. Could also substitute for grease to lubricate mechanical devices.
With a face only a mother could love, and only a gurangatch would eat.
Prized by perfumers as a base note of unparalleled potency. How this application was first determined is a mystery in and of itself.
Exquisitely wrought cat's-eye earrings. The setting of one is damaged, though the gem appears to be unharmed.
A large burlap sack filled with assorted ores of unknown value.
Crafted by master goldsmith Niellefresne and named for the woman who served as his inspiration. The masterful use of cat's-eye is breathtaking.
Documents detailing the Scions' planned operations for the next several weeks.
Enchanted with magicks of questionable potency, these stones are coveted by the scholarly and superstitious alike.
Some might argue that quality craftsmanship is wasted on devices that will be used only once. Such individuals have no appreciation for the finer things in life.
Marked for shipment to Revenant's Toll and filled with heavy, unknown items. Remember to lift with your legs, not your back.
Harvested from a species native to Coerthas. When brewed, they yield a refreshing tea. This is not how Tataru intends to use them.
Raimondaux won't be getting far without this.
A delectable canine treat that was not made using a plump Lalafell.
A seemingly abandoned pup with a growling stomach.
A defenseless baby coeurl.

A timeworn leather map revealing the location of an unknown treasure.

※Level 40 recommended.

A timeworn goatskin map revealing the location of an unknown treasure.

※Level 45 recommended.

A timeworn toadskin map revealing the location of an unknown treasure.

※Level 50 recommended.

A timeworn boarskin map revealing the location of an unknown treasure.

※Level 50 recommended.

A timeworn peisteskin map revealing the location of an unknown treasure.

※Level 50 full party (8 players) recommended.
This unblemished earth crystal is the main component used in the ritual the kobolds perform to summon Titan.
This unblemished water crystal is the main component used in the ritual the Sahagin perform to summon Leviathan.
This unblemished fire crystal is the main component used in the ritual the Amalj'aa perform to summon Ifrit.
This unblemished wind crystal is the main component used in the ritual the Ixal perform to summon Garuda.
These grains of sand were refined from a fire-kissed ore of incredible rarity and hardness.
These grains of sand were refined from an earth-cradled ore of incredible rarity and hardness.
This hefty sack of gil has been promised to the Goldsmiths' Guild in exchange for any available aethersand.
These grains of sand were refined from a wind-touched ore of incredible rarity and hardness.
These grains of sand were refined from a water-blessed ore of incredible rarity and hardness.
Venom extracted from a ziz. Drinking it is hazardous to one's health.
The liver of an orobon. Eating it is hazardous to one's health.
Bile extracted from a morbol. Touching it is hazardous to one's health.
Decaying skin flayed from a zombie. Smelling it is hazardous to one's health.
A gelatinous mass procured from a pudding. Looking at it is hazardous to one's health.
A prohibited substance. Merely knowing of its existence is hazardous to one's health.
A confection lovingly prepared by Nemoh Maimhov for her one true love.
A small package cast to the ground by Captain Rhoswen of the Sanguine Sirens. It gives off a faintly sweet aroma.
A sealed parcel that, from the sound of it, houses a metallic implement of some sort.
A parcel containing a piece of woodwork.
A parcel containing assorted phials of varicolored liquids.
These red-hot cores are oft used to incinerate materials that are otherwise resistant to ordinary fires.
The shell of a giant tortoise.
A set of ritual tools used by the Amalj'aa in their summoning rites.
A ritual offering the Amalj'aa consign to the flames during their summoning rites.
Assorted vegetables harvested from the forest. Though likely edible, their pungent aroma suggests that the taste would likely not be worth the effort required to prepare them for consumption.
Stomach juices extracted from a morbol. Exudes a stench that would get the bearer arrested in at least three citystates.
Freshly picked treant acorns give off a pleasant arboreal aroma. This one...doesn't.
Potent poison extracted from a fallen ziz. A single whiff would suffice to set one's nostril hairs aflame.
A slippery substance secreted by a dreamtoad. Known to enhance the hallucinatory effects of milkroot.
Naturally harvested milkroot of impressive size and potency. Said to fetch a high price on the black market.
An iron statuette forged in the likeness of Ifrit.

The legacy of Minfilia's father, who perished in the parade incident of 1562 when a goobbue broke free of its magical fetters and ran amok through the streets of Ul'dah. Contains a wealth of stolen imperial research on the primals, as well as other information which has yet to be deciphered.
Writ upon this map of the Sagolii Desert in a flamboyant, flowing hand are the words “A gentleman is, rather than does.”
Many cope with grief by taking up new pursuits, such as travel or exercise. Nashu chose to study explosives.
This is not the sword you are looking for.
A completely useless and unremarkable rock. Come now, what were you expecting? A rock that keeps coeurls away?
Well, at least you didn't pick up a rock at random like some people.
Housing but a pittance of coins, this threadbare trifle represents the contents of Ealdwine's treasured discovery in full.
This fine specimen of carrot is said to symbolize the majesty of horses.
This fine specimen of carrot is said to symbolize the swiftness of horses.
A carrot grown at the Red Rooster Stead.
An uncommonly large carrot grown at the Red Rooster Stead.
This fine specimen of carrot is said to symbolize the vigor of horses.
The key to an Amalj'aa-made cage.
The key to an Amalj'aa-made cage.
A clear sap drawn from a desert succulent.
A gruesome ritual tool fashioned from the bones of an Ixal.
